member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBrush.Opacity
member.summary: Opacity of the brush in interval 0..1 0 -- full transparency 1 -- full opacity. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBrush.ShadingModel
member.summary: Shading model that should be applied to an object if it's painted with this brush. You should understand that different shading models are not always supported. For example if you paint some background with the brush only plain shading (read -- no shading) is possible. But if you paint some 3d-object different models can be chosen (it is possible to draw this object as if it was lightened by some light source).

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmoother
member.summary: The NChartDataSmoother class provides basic data smoother used to create smooth charts by only a few points.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmoother.Resolution
member.summary: Resolution of the spline. Resolution is the number of subdivisions by the step dimension for each segment. The default value is 32. The allowed value are [2..1024].

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmoother.StepDimension
member.summary: Key of the value that should be interpreted as step dimension. Typically it is NChartValue.X (which is the default value), however for bar series it should be NChartValue.Y.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmoother.ValueDimension
member.summary: Key of the value that should be interpreted as height dimension. Typically it is NChartValue.Y (which is the default value), however for bar series it should be NChartValue.X.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmootherLagrange
member.summary: The NChartDataSmootherLagrange class provides data smoother based on Lagrange polynoms used to create smooth lines on the charts by only a few points. Typically this smoother is used for line and area series. This smoother ensures the best smoothing in comparison with NChartDataSmootherTBezier and NChartDataSmootherSBezier, but has large deviation from the linear data interpolation (even larger than NChartDataSmooterSpline) and can produce large fake extremums. It may be good for some, but generally it's recommended to use NChartDataSmootherTBezier instead.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmootherSBezier
member.summary: The NChartDataSmootherSBezier class provides data smoother based on bezier interpolation (with control points calculated to ensure defect 1 spline) used to create smooth lines on the charts by only a few points. Typically this smoother is used for line and area series. This smoother ensures better smoothing in comparison with NChartDataSmootherTBezier, but has larger deviation from the linear data interpolation and can produce fake extremums. However, the deviation of the fake extremums is smaller in comparison with NChartDataSmootherSpline and NChartDataSmootherLagrange.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmootherSpline
member.summary: The NChartDataSmootherSpline class provides data smoother based on cubic splines used to create smooth lines on the charts by only a few points. Typically this smoother is used for line and area series. This smoother ensures the best smoothing in comparison with NChartDataSmootherTBezier and NChartDataSmootherSBezier, but has large deviation from the linear data interpolation and can produce large fake extremums.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartDataSmootherTBezier
member.summary: The NChartDataSmootherTBezier class provides data smoother based on bezier interpolation (with control points calculated according to tangents to the curve being smoothed) used to create smooth lines on the charts by only a few points. Typically this smoother is used for line and area series. This smoother ensures minimal deviation from the linear data interpolation (in comparison with NChartDataSmootherSpline, NChartDataSmootherLagrange and NChartDataSmootherSBezier) and guarantees the absence of fake extremums.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBrushScale
member.summary:
The NChartBrushScale class provides scale that transforms values into brushes like a step mapping function. The scale contains array of reference values and array of brushes. It returns brush for given value according to these arrays:
brushs[n] values[n - 1] ... brushs[4] values[3] brushs[3] values[2] brushs[2] values[1] brushs[1] values[0] brushs[0]
This is equivalent to the following pseudo code:
if value <= values[0] return brushes[0]; if value > values[i] and value <= values[i + 1] return brush[i + 1]; if value > values[last] return brush[last]
So the array of brushes should contain n elements and array of values should contain n - 1. Values should be sorted (NChartBrushScale does not sort them automatically). If they are not, it can lead to strange results. If brush index goes out of range, nil is returned.

- array of values reperesented with NSNumber.

member.summary: The NChartMarker class provides methods to display markers in the points of the chart.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.Shape
member.summary: Shape of the marker. There are predefined shapes and NChartMarkerShapeModel that requires the model to be set.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.Model
member.summary: Model of the marker. This property is null by default. By setting this property shape is automatically set to NChartMarkerShape.Model. If the shape is not NChartMarkerShape.Model this property has no effect even if it is not null. If the shape is NChartMarkerShape.Model and model is null it is equivalent to the shape set to NChartMarkerShape.None so no marker is displayed.

member.summary: Brush that fills the marker.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.BorderBrush
member.summary: Brush of the marker's border. Please note that only markers with predefined shapes have borders. If you use model border's properties are ignored.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.BorderThickness
member.summary: Thickness of the marker's border in pixels. Please note that only markers with predefined shapes have borders. If you use a model the border's properties are ignored.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.AngleX
member.summary: Rotation of the marker around the X-axis in radians. This property is used for "volumetric" markers only this means for those that are not plain.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.AngleY
member.summary: Rotation of the marker around the Y-axis in radians. This property is used for "volumetric" markers only this means for those that are not plain.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.AngleZ
member.summary: Rotation of the marker around the Z-axis in radians. This property is used for "volumetric" markers only this means for those that are not plain.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.Size
member.summary: Size of the marker. The size can be in any unit you want. It is rescaled to pixels with the help of NChartSizeAxis. If no data source is set for size axis, units are interpreted as pixels. See also NChartSizeAxis.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.SelectionSize
member.summary: Size of the marker's touch area (the area you can touch to select the corresponding chart point). If this size is zero, touch area has the size of marker (that is set with Size property). The default value is 0.0f. Use this property if you want to make touch area more or less then the marker size. The size can be in any unit you want. It is rescaled to pixels with the help of NChartSizeAxis. If no data source is set for size axis, units are interpreted as pixels. See also NChartSizeAxis.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartMarker.Resolution
member.summary: Resoution of the marker. Resolution is the amount of vertices that build the circle (sphere). It is used if marker's shape is NChartMarkerShape.Circle or NChartMarkerShape.Sphere. This value cannot be less than 3 and greater than 32. See also Shape.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPointState
member.summary: The NChartPointState class provides methods to store state of a point. The state of a point is a complex of parameters such as position brush used etc. for a particular period for a particular point. Each chart point should have at least one state representing the data from the data source for this point but it can have multiple states. This allows the animation of a chart through time while each NChartPointState represents the state of the point in a particular time tick. The transition from one state to another is animated automatically by linear interpolation of parameters stored in the states.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPointState.Brush
member.summary: Brush that fills the point. See NChartBrush.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPointState.BorderBrush
member.summary: Brush of the point's border. See NChartBrush.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPointState.Marker
member.summary: Marker of the point. See NChartMarker.

member.summary: Thickness of the border (in pixels) that is drawn around the text container.

member.summary: Margin of the text container in pixels (spacing from the bounds of the enclosing area).

member.summary: Alignment of the label's text.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTooltip
member.summary: The NChartTooltip class provides methods to display the tooltip for the chart's points.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTooltip.SetVisibleAnimated(System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Change visibility of tooltip animated.
member.param: flag of visibility.
duration of animation in seconds.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTooltip.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Vertical alignment of the tooltip. It is used if tooltip has no arrow presented otherwise it is ignored.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTooltip.DefaultArrowOrientation
member.summary: Default orientation of the tooltip's arrow. The default value is NChartTooltipArrowOrientation.Bottom.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTooltip.AlwaysInPlotArea
member.summary: Flag determining if the tooltip should always be inside of the chart's plot area. If true, the tooltip may be shifted to fit in the plot area when it's pivot is near the border of the chart's plot area. If false, it is never shifted and can overlap the axis when it's pivot is near the border of the chart's plot area. The default value is true.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCallout
member.summary: The NChartCallout class provides methods to display tooltips as callouts.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCallout.LineThickness
member.summary: Thickness of the callout line. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCallout.LineColor
member.summary: Color of the callout line. The default value is UIColor.Black.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCallout.LineToLabelConnectionPos
member.summary: Position where the line connects to the label. The default value is NChartCalloutLineToLabelConnectionPos.Autodetect.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCallout.Distance
member.summary: Distance from the chart's point to the callout's tooltip in the autodetected direction (in pixels). If this property is 0, margin is used to control this distance (and therefore you control the direction yourself). Otherwise, the direction is detected automatically. In case of pie it's median of the corresponding sector. In case of all other charts it's north-east direction. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCallout.LineType
member.summary: Type of callout line. The default value is NChartCalloutLineTypeStraight.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTimeAxisTooltip
member.summary: The NChartTimeAxisTooltip class provides methods to display the tooltip over the handler of the time axis.

member.summary: The NChartAutoScrollLabel provides methods to control the label that is shown whenever auto scroll mode of chart is toggled.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAutoScrollLabel.OnText
member.summary: Text that should appear on the label whenever auto scroll is ON. The default value is null.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAutoScrollLabel.OffText
member.summary: Text that should appear on the label whenever auto scroll is OFF. The default value is null.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAutoScrollLabel.FadeTime
member.summary: Fade time of the label (in seconds). The default value is 0.25.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAutoScrollLabel.VisibleTime
member.summary: Time the label is visible (in seconds). The default value is 1.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Constructor(NChart3D_iOS.NChartPointState[],NChart3D_iOS.NChartSeries)
member.summary: Create point with an array of states.
member.param: The array of point states. See NChartPointState for details.
The series the point belongs to.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Constructor(NChart3D_iOS.NChartPointState,NChart3D_iOS.NChartSeries)
member.summary: Create point with a single state.
member.param: The state if point. See NChartPointState for details.
The series the point belongs to.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Series
member.summary: Series the point belongs to.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.States
member.summary: Array of states. See NChartPointState for details. If a point was created with a single state the array of states is not allocated and this property returns null.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.CurrentStateIndex
member.summary: Index of current state. If a point was created with a single state this property always returns 0.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.CurrentState
member.summary: Direct access to current state. This is a bit faster and more convenient than a query element of the states' array by currentStateIndex. If a point was created with a single state this property is the only way to access it.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Tooltip
member.summary: Tooltip that is shown on the point. It is null by default. The tooltip is just a label it does not change its content automatically. By altering its text you can display any information you want but you should do it yourself. Tooltip is similar to label but it is placed in the center of the point by default. You can have tooltip and label simultaneously displaying different information.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Label
member.summary: Label that is shown near the point. It is null by default. The label does not change its content automatically. By altering its text you can display any information you want but you should do it yourself. Label is similar to tooltip but it is placed in the top of the point by default. You can have tooltip and label simultaneously displaying different information.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.HighlightColor
member.summary: Highlight color. Some points can be highlighted by color for example in column pie or bubble (where the points are individual objects). In series like line and area the color highlight can be applied to the markers so for these series this property has effect only if the marker is set.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.HighlightShift
member.summary: Highlight shift. Some points can be highlighted by shift for example in pie. The shift is set in scene units. For example the radius of pie is 1 scene unit so you can use this value as a reference.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Highlight(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Highlight point using the highlight settings done by HighlightColor and HighlightShift properties.
member.param: mask of highlighting. See NChartHighlightType enum for details. You may use multiple constants concatenated with bitwise OR.
duration of highlighting animation in seconds.
delay to start of highlighting animation in seconds.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPoint.Tag
member.summary: Tag of the point. You may use it as you want.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTouchArea
member.summary: The NChartTouchArea class provides methods to define touch area for NChartTouchAreaSeries. Area is defined in relative coordinates that should be in [0, 1]x[0, 1] and relates to the size of background set through NChartTouchAreaSeriesSettings. (0, 0) corresponds to the top-left corner of the background image, (1, 1) - to the bottom-right.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartTouchArea.Constructor(CoreGraphics.CGRect,NChart3D_iOS.NChartSeries)

member.param: Area for touch area.
The series the point belongs to.

member.summary: Touch area rect.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.Name(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get the name that is displayed in the axis' caption.
member.param: axis to get the name for.
member.returns: the name of the axis.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.Min(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get the minimal value for the axis. If there is no implementation the axis is assumed to be discrete and you should provide an array of ticks. If neither min and max nor an array of ticks are provided the axis is assumed to be continuous and both min and max are calculated automatically based on the values for the series.
member.param: axis to get minimal value for.
member.returns: the minimal value for the axis. It may be null that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.Max(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get the maximal value for the axis. If there is no implementation the axis is assumed to be discrete and you should provide an array of ticks. If neither min and max nor an array of ticks are provided the axis is assumed to be continuous and both min and max are calculated automatically based on the values for the series.
member.param: axis to get the maximal value for.
member.returns: the maximal value for the axis. It may be null that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.Step(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get step value for axis. If there is no implementation the step min and max values are beautified.
member.param: axis to get the step value for.
member.returns: the step value for the axis. It may be null that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.Ticks(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get array of ticks for the discrete axis. You should provide it if min and max are not implemented. If they are implemented the array of ticks is ignored. If neither min and max nor the array of ticks are provided axis is assumed to be continuous and both min and max are calculated automatically based on the values for the series.
member.param: axis to get an array of ticks for.
member.returns: an array of strings that represent the ticks. It may be null that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.ExtraTicks(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get array of extra ticks for discrete axis. Use this method to provide additional ticks for axis. This method is called after you call extendData of NChart. The ticks from the array returned are _added_ to the axis' array of ticks, so axis will have more data. The maximal length of ticks array is determined by pointsHistoryLength property of NChart. Due to performance reasons you won't have access to the newly created ticks through the ticks method of the NChartValueAxis.
member.param: axis to get an array of ticks for.
member.returns: array of extra ticks.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.Length(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get length of axis in 3D scene units. If there is no implementation 1 is used. See length of NChartValueAxis for details.
member.param: axis to get the length for.
member.returns: the length of the axis. It may be null that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.DoubleToString(System.Double,NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Convert double value to string.
member.returns: string representation of the value.
member.param: value to convert.
axis to convert value for.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.MinDate(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get the minimal date for the axis. If there is no implementation, both min and max are calculated automatically based on the date from the series. This method is called in date mode of the value axis only. See hasDates method of the NChartValueAxis for details.
member.param: - axis to get minimal date for.
member.returns: the minimal date for the axis. It may be nil that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxisDataSource.MaxDate(NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis)
member.summary: Get the maximal date for the axis. If there is no implementation, both min and max are calculated automatically based on the date from the series. This method is called in date mode of the value axis only. See hasDates method of the NChartValueAxis for details.
member.param: - axis to get maximal date for.
member.returns: the maximal date for the axis. It may be nil that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

member.summary: Get date step value for axis. If there is no implementation, the step, min and max values are beautified. This method is called in date mode of the value axis only. See hasDates method of the NChartValueAxis for details.

member.returns: number representing time interval of the date step value for the axis. It may be nil that is equivalent to the absence of implementation.

- axis to convert value for.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MinValue
member.summary: Minimal value on the axis. It is obtained from the data source and if needed processed to look more beautiful.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MaxValue
member.summary: Maximal value on the axis. It is obtained from the data source and if needed processed to look more beautiful.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Step
member.summary: Step from one tick to another. It is either obtained from the data source or if not provided calculated according to the MinValue and MaxValue to look beautiful.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MinDate
member.summary: Minimal date on the axis. It is obtained from the data source and, if needed, processed to look more beautiful. This property works in date mode only, if HasDates is true. Otherwise it returns null.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MaxDate
member.summary: Maximal date on the axis. It is obtained from the data source and, if needed, processed to look more beautiful. This property works in date mode only, if HasDates is true. Otherwise it returns null.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.DateStep
member.summary: Time interval from one date tick to another. It is either obtained from the data source or, if not provided, calculated according to the MinDate and MaxDate to look beautiful. This property works in date mode only, if HasDates is true. Otherwise it returns 0.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Ticks
member.summary: Array of strings that are displayed as ticks on the axis. It is obtained from the data source or null if not provided.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.TickCount
member.summary: Number of ticks on the axis. It is the number of ticks in an array or the number of values between MinValue and MaxValue through step.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Length
member.summary: Length of axis in 3D scene units. This value is obtained from the data source or if not provided is assigned to 1. It has an effect for axes being displayed in 3D only. In 2D this value is ignored because axes fill the whole area available on the screen. One 3D scene unit is equal to half a screen size by initial zoom (so space of the 3D scene is actually nonlinear respective to the screen). Therefore by default all axes have equal length and form a kind of cube in 3D that is centered on the screen and is as big as half of the biggest screen's dimension. However if you want for example to make the Z-axis shorter than the others you can provide a length of 0.5 for it. It will therefore be twice as short as the others.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Color
member.summary: Color of the axis line.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Font
member.summary: Font for the ticks' labels.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.TextColor
member.summary: Color of the text for the ticks' labels.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.HasOffset
member.summary: Flag that determines if there should be an offset on the axis. The offset is the spacing from the beginning of the axis to the first tick and from the last tick to the end of the axis. If this flag is true the spacing is half a step. If false spacing is zero.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MinTickSpacing
member.summary: Minimal spacing between neighbor ticks in pixels (the tick is the center place of the timestamp title a kind of milestone on the axis). According to this value some timestamps can be hidden if there are too many of them.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MaxLabelLength
member.summary: Maximal allowed label length in pixels. If 0, maximal label width is calculated automatically according to the length between neighbor ticks. The default value is 0.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.LabelsLineBreakMode
member.summary: Line break mode for axis labels. The default value is UILineBreakMode.ByWordWrapping.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Thickness
member.summary: Thickness of the axis' line in pixels.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MajorTicks
member.summary: Major ticks of the axis. Major ticks are spread from the minValue to the maxValue through step or if no MinValue and MaxValue are provided but a ticks array is provided the whole axis length is divided by the number of ticks and for each tick there is a major tick displayed.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.MinorTicks
member.summary: Minor ticks of the axis. Minor ticks are displayed in the middle between two neighbor major ticks. See MajorTicks for details.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.Caption
member.summary: Caption of the axis.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.LabelsVisible
member.summary: Flag that determines if the labels of ticks are visible (true) or not (false). The default value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.LineVisible
member.summary: Flag that determines if the line of the axis is visible (true) or not (false). The default value is false.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.AlwaysShowZero
member.summary: Flag that determines whether zero is always on the axis. This flag makes sense if MinValue and MaxValue are both less or greater than zero and are beautified according to the data source. In this case if this flag is false it may happen that no zero will be on the axis (for example if MinValue = 11.5 and MaxValue = 19 the axis will probably start with 10 and end with 20 having 4 steps). With this flag set to true zero will always be on the axis so even with MinValue = 11.5 and MaxValue = 19 the axis will start with 0 and end with 20 having probably 5 steps or so. The default value is false.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.LabelsIn3D
member.summary: Flag that determines whether the axis labels are in "perspective" screen (true) or are projected in the 2D screen (false). This flag only affects 3D-charts. The default value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.CaptionIn3D
member.summary: Flag that determines whether the axis caption is in "perspective" screen (true) or is projected in the 2D screen (false). This flag only affects 3D-charts. The deafult value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.ShouldBeautifyMinAndMax
member.summary: Flag that detemines whether min and max values on the axis should be beautified in case they are calculated (true) or not (false). The default vaule is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.LabelsAngle
member.summary: Axis labels' rotation angle. See NChart.DrawIn3D. See LabelsIn3D.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.LabelsAlignment
member.summary: Alignment of the axis labels relative to the axis ticks. The default value is NChartAxisLabelsAlignment.Center.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.CalcOptimalMinTickSpacing
member.summary: Calculate optimal value for MinTickSpacing. Use this method if you want to get MinTickSpacing that corresponds to the actual lengths of axis ticks' labels. You should call this method _after_ the UpdateData call of the chart, because this method operates with the data obtained from data source. If you call it before the data are updated, the result will be wrong.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.FitZoomByMinTickSpacing(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Fit the zoom according to the current MinTickSpacing. Use this method if you want to zoom the chart so that the maximal number of points is visible with no skipping of ticks on the axis. This method requires frame of the chart to be determined. So if you call this method before the chart's layout, it will fail. If you want the axes to be automatically zoomed according to the MinTickSpacing, use the flag ShouldAutoFitZoomByMinTickSpacing.
member.param: - duration of the animation in seconds.
- delay of animation in seconds.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.ShouldAutoFitZoomByMinTickSpacing
member.summary: Flag determining if zoom of the axis should be automatically fit according to the current MinTickSpacing (true) or not (false). The default value is false. Set this flag to true if you want to zoom the chart so that the maximal number of points is visible with no skipping of ticks on the axis. Best practice is to set this flag and call CalcOptimalMinTickSpacing. If this flag is set to true, zoom of the axis is changed automatically by each chart's layout. Zoom you set manually before layout will be ignored. Auto fitting works in 2D mode only.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartValueAxis.HasDates

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAxesPlane.Width
member.summary: Width of the axes plane in 3D scene units. Actually one 3D scene unit is equal to half a screen size by the initial zoom (therefore the space of 3D scene is actually nonlinear respectively to the screen). Of course you can try to calculate out the value you need but you would find it out easier experimentally. The default value is 0.05.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAxisGrid
member.summary: The NChartAxisGrid class provides methods to display the grid for the chart's axes.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAxisGrid.Color
member.summary: Color of the grid lines.

member.summary: Thickness of the grid lines in pixels. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAxisGrid.InterlacedBackground
member.summary: Array of brushes for interlaced background. If null, no interlaced background is displayed. The default value is null. Interlaced background means that the space between axis grid lines is filled with the colors that are consecutively taken from this array. The array is looped, so if there are less elements then spaces between grid lines, the sequence of colors is multiplied. The elements of the array should be objects NChartSolidColorBrush. Only NChartSolidColorBrush is supported, all other brushes (or other objects will be skipped).

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.ValueAxesType
member.summary: Type of axes. You may use additional and percent axes only if you provide ticks for category axes. For example if you are about to display additional columns you should provide ticks for the X and Z axes. If you are about to display additional bars you should provide ticks for Y and Z axes respectively (because bars are stretched along the X-axis). If you didn't provide ticks for category axes changing the type to additional or percent takes no effect for the series displayed even though states of their points are aligned to the grid (see NChartPointState for details).

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.ShouldAutoZoom
member.summary: Flag determining if auto zoom mode is on (true), or off (false). The default value is false. In auto zoom mode, the axis set to be auto-zoomed by the AutoZoomAxes property is zoomed automatically so that the visible part of the chart is fit to the polt area. This property takes effect in 2D mode only.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.AutoZoomAxes
member.summary: The axes kind (normal, secondary or both) to be auto-zoomed. The default value is NChartAutoZoomAxes.NormalAxis. The axes set to be auto-zoomed are zoomed by panning so that the visible part of the chart is fit to the polt area, if ShouldAutoZoom is true. If axes are not swapped (you are not using bar series), the axes to zoom are Y and SY. In other case, they are X and SX. This property takes effect in 2D mode only. It is strongly recommended to disable the user interactions related to the direction of the axes which should be zoomed automatically. For example, if you set AutoZoomAxes to NChartAutoZoomAxes.NormalAxis, and the axis are not swapped (you are not using bar series, so the axes to zoom are Y and SY), you are recommended to disable proportional zoom, vertical zoom and vertical pan: m_view.Chart.UserInteractionMode = (m_view.Chart.UserInteractionMode) ^ (NChartUserInteraction.ProportionalZoom | NChartUserInteraction.VerticalZoom | NChartUserInteraction.VerticalMove);, as well as to set the ZoomMode to directional: m_view.Chart.ZoomMode = NChartZoomMode.Directional; See also NChartAutoZoomAxes.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.AutoAxesIntersectionValue
member.summary: Flag determining if the value where the axes intersect should be calculated automatically (true) or not (false). The defaut value is true. If this flag is true, axes intersect in their minimum.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.AutoSAxesIntersectionValue
member.summary: Flag determining if the value where the secondary axes intersect should be calculated automatically (true) or not (false). The defaut value is true. If this flag is true, axes intersect in their minimum.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.AxesIntersectionValue
member.summary: Value axes intersect in. It's calculated automatically by default. Setting this value will take effect if AutoAxesIntersectionValue is false only.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCartesianSystem.SAxesIntersectionValue
member.summary: Value secondary axes intersect in. It's calculated automatically by default. Setting this value will take effect if AutoSAxesIntersectionValue is false only.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartSizeAxis
member.summary: The NChartSizeAxis class provides methods to scale the sizes of NChartMarker objects. The idea is to map the value of marker's size that is assumed to be in (MinValue maxValue) to the (MinSize MaxSize). For example if a particular marker has size 0.3555 MinValue = 0 MaxValue = 1 MinSize = 10 (pixels) and MaxSize = 100 (pixels) the actual size of the marker on the screen will be 42 pixels.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChart
member.summary:
The NChart class provides a container for the chart.
The main NChart3D features are the following.
- 2D charts: - Column - Bar - Area - Line - Step line - Pie - Doughnut - Bubble - Scatter - Candlestick - OHLC - Band - Sequence - Radar - Funnel - Heatmap - 3D charts: - Column, cylinder column - Bar, cylinder bar - Area - Line - Step line - Ribbon - Pie - Doughnut - Bubble - Scatter - Candlestick - OHLC - Surface - Funnel - Streaming: - Realtime data updating - Support of multithreading - Data processing: - Automatic minimum, maximum and step calculation for value axes according to supplied dataset - Spline-based data smoothing - Animations: - Animated changing of view angles - Animated changing of zoom - Animated zooming to given region - Support of different animation curves - Automatic animation on the dataset change - High visual quality: - Adaptive anti-aliasing - Fitting chart to screen - Flexible axes: - Absolute, additive and percent value axis types - Multiple value axes - Custom numeric values on the axes - Time axis - Size axis - Polar coordinate system - Interactivity: - Zoom, pan and rotation of the chart - Interactive legend - Advanced customizations: - Advanced control over user interactions - Themes and color customization - Custom background image - Alignment of chart caption - Rotation of axes labels - Label in the center of pie - Flexible tooltips and chart annotations - Parallel and perspective projections in 3D-mode - Selection of points by color and offset - Markers for points - Multiple charts in a single view - Crosshair

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.UpdateData
member.summary: Force chart to be updated. Call this method when you want to reload data from the data source and rebuild the chart. Data are processed by this call and minimums / maximums on axes are calculated.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ExtendData
member.summary: Force chart to extend the points arrays of series. Only newly added data are processed by this call. Minimums and maximums may change. Call this method always you want to extend the data array without changing old data. This method causes series to query new portion of data through ExtraPoints(NChartSeries series); call of their data sources. But you cannot extend the array of points forever, so there is a property PointsHistoryLength that determines the length of history. The difference with UpdateData() is that only newly added points are processed and the array of these points is queried through ExtraPoints(NChartSeries series); call of NChartSeriesDataSource. This can save you time by updating large data sets. See also NChartSeriesDataSource.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.PointsHistoryLength
member.summary: Property that determines the maximal length of series' points array. The default value is 1000. The array of points in series is determined after UpdateData() call (by querying points from series' data sources) and then can be extended after ExtendData() call. The property PointsHistoryLength takes effect by using ExtendData() only. The new points are added to the end of the points' array of the series and if the array exceeds the given length, first n points are deleted, where n = array.length - pointsHistoryLength.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.RebuildSeries
member.summary: Force series to rebuild by reloading data from data source. Call this method when you know that the chart layout (including layout of axes, so min and max values) has not changed, but the data in series have. This method invokes UpdateSeries() automatically. Data are not processed by this call, so values on axes remain unchanged. Use this method if you are absolutely sure minimums and maximums have not changed!

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.UpdateSeries
member.summary: Force series to be updated without reloading data from data source. Call this method when you want to reflect some changes you made in the visual appearance of a series (brush, etc.). A call of RebuildSeries invokes UpdateSeries automatically.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.StreamingMode
member.summary: Flag determining if streaming mode is enabled. The default value is false. If streaming mode is set to true, PointSelectionEnabled is automatically set to false to boost the performance of data updating. See StreamData

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.StreamData
member.summary: Stream the data. This causes the updating of chart to display new states of points. The data are going to be processed, so minimum and maximum on the axes may change. Use this method in the following use-case: if your set of points was not changed, but the values in the states of points do, you can update the chart thrugh this method much faster than through regular UpdateData. The difference with RebuildSeries is that StreamData _does not_ reload data from data source, but _does_ the optimized data processing (it's faster than regular data processing). Series will use the points they already have (the points are mutable, so you can change their data anywhere you want). The difference with UpdateSeries is that StreamData is even faster and _does_ the optimized data processing. So use it to reflect some realtime "streaming" changes of data. This method requires StreamingMode to be on, use StreamingMode = true for this. The first appearance of series should be initialized by the UpdateData call. StreamData is to change the already displayed series only.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.IncrementalMinMaxMode
member.summary: Incremental minimum and maximum calculation mode. This mode makes sense in streaming mode only. If the incremental mode is on, new minimum cannot be gearter and new maximum cannot be less than the ones calculated on the previous datasets. The default value is false.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.FlushChanges
member.summary: Synchronize all the changes with visual appearance. You may call this method after all your data is updated (it means after you called updateData and PlayTransition because PlayTransition only says that transition should start playing and does not wait till it plays completely) to ensure that the visual appearance will be updated as soon as possible. You may call this method on the big dataset to reduce lag between your updateData call and actual updating.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.Relayout
member.summary: Force chart to relayout. Call this method if you made some changes but do not want to update data. A call of UpdateData invokes relayout automatically.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.AlignCenter(System.Single)
member.summary: Change position so that the chart is aligned to the center of the screen. This method takes effect in 3D mode only.
member.param: duration of the animation in seconds.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.FitToScreen(System.Single)
member.summary: Change zoom and position so that the chart fits the screen (with current rotation, if in 3D).
member.param: duration of the animation in seconds.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.Zoom
member.summary: Zoom of the chart. The default zoom is 1 which corresponds to the fitting the chart to screen (both in 2D and 3D). The zooming is proportional. If you want non-proportional zoom in 2D mode, you should use ZoomToRegionFrom method of NChartValueAxis. If you want to alter the initial zoom, you should change the value of this property after UpdateData call.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ZoomTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Zoom of the chart. The default zoom is 1 which corresponds to the fitting the chart to screen (both in 2D and 3D). The zooming is proportional. If you want non-proportional zoom in 2D mode, you should use ZoomToRegionFrom method of NChartValueAxis. If you want to alter the initial zoom, you should change the value of this property after UpdateData call.
member.param: new zoom of the chart.
duration of the animation in seconds.
delay of the animation in seconds.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.MinZoom
member.summary: Minimal zoom of the chart. After this zoom is reached by user interactions, chart starts bouncing zoom. The minimal zoom differs in 2D and 3D mode. In 3D mode the default value is 0.5. In 2D it is 1.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShouldCalculate2DZoomBoundsAutomatically
member.summary: Flag determining if zoom in 2D mode should be calculated automatically (true) or not (false). The default value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.MaxZoom
member.summary: Maximal zoom of the chart. After this zoom is reached by user interactions, chart starts bouncing zoom. The maximal zoom differs in 2D and 3D mode. In 2D mode the default value is recalculated each time the chart is layed out (by changing of the frame or by updating data) according to the data on the axes. In 3D the default value is 2.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.Pivot
member.summary: Pivot of the chart in the internal chart scene coordinates. Use this property if you want to save and than restore position of the chart. This property works for 2D and 3D modes. Theoretically you can use this property to pan the chart programmatically, however it is better to use ZoomToRegionFrom method of NChartValueAxis.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.PointSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Flag determining if the chart points can be selected by tap (true) or not (false). The default value is true. If you do not want to select points by tap, it is better to disable selection, because it will save memory and boost the data updating.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ResetTransformations(System.Single)
member.summary: Reset all transformations to default values.
member.param: Duration of animation from current transformations to the beginning.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.PlayTransition(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Play animated transition from old state to new one. The old state is cached automatically, so the only thing you need to do for animation is to change the series (by calling AddSeries / RemoveSeries / RemoveAllSeries) or data in the series (by updating data source and calling UpdateData) and than call PlayTransition. State is cached when UpdateData is called.
member.param: Duration of animation from current transformations to the beginning.
Flag determining if animation should be played in reverse.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ResetTransition
member.summary: Reset transition by cleaning up the cache made from the previous UpdateData call. Call this method if you want to see animation from the default start positions as if you just started the app.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.IsTransitionPlaying
member.summary: Check if transition is playing.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.StopTransition
member.summary: Stop transition. This will stop all the transition animations, even if they are not played till the end or if they where delayed and did not even start animating.

member.summary: Caption of the chart.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.Margin
member.summary: Margin of the chart that determines how far the content of chart starts from view's bounds. The default margin is zero on all sides.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShowFPS
member.summary: Flag that determines if FPS rate should be displayed (true) or not (false). You may use this for debug purposes or if you are just curious, but it's a very bad idea to show FPS in production code, because it results in continuous rendering that loads CPU and consumes power. If FPS is off, the picture is re-rendered only if it's really needed. The default value is false.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShouldAntialias
member.summary: Flag that determines if the image should be anti-aliased (true) or not (false). Antialiasing makes the picture smoother, but impacts performance. The default value is false.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.AdaptiveAntialiasing
member.summary: Flag that determines if anti-aliasing is adaptive (true) or not (false). Adaptivity means that it is switched off automatically for the time-critical periods like user interactions or animation playing. This property takes effect if ShouldAntialias is true only. The default value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ZoomMode
member.summary: Zoom mode used in chart. The default is NChartZoomMode.Proportional.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ZoomToPointMode
member.summary: Flag that determines if chart is zoomed to the cursor (true) or to the screen center (false). The default value is false.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShouldBounceZoom
member.summary: Flag that determines if zoom should bounce (true) or not (false). The default value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShouldBouncePan
member.summary: Flag that determines if pan should bounce (true) or not (false). The default value is true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.UserInteractionMode
member.summary: Intercation mode used in the chart. The default is NChartUserInteractionAll. You can use multiple interactions concatenated with bitwise OR to specify the mask of what is available.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShadingModel
member.summary: Shading model that is used in 3D mode. The default value is NChartShadingModelPhong. This property controls shading for the 3D charts like surfaces, columns, etc. Shading model for point markers is controlled through their brushes. This property takes effect in 3D mode only.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.AlwaysPreserveZoomAndPosition
member.summary: Flag determining if chart content always preserves zoom and position (true) or not (false). This flag takes effect in 3D mode only. If this flag is set to false, when you change the frame of the chart, 3D content will be zoomed and shifted to fit the screen. If this flag is set to true, you should call ResetTransformations to fit the content in the screen manually. The default value is false. The common use-case for this flag is when you smoothly change the size of the chart. For such resize session you should set this flag to true, and after the session you should probably call ResetTransformations.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Begin data chnaging transaction. You should call this method before any changes of chart settings/data in separate thread. After the changes are made, you should call EndTransaction. The typical use-case of multithreading in NChart3D is the streaming - the realtime data updating. There is no sense to call this method in main thread.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.EndTransaction
member.summary: End data changing transaction. See also BeginTransaction.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.shouldConvertZoomToAllowed
member.summary: Flag determining if all zoom should be converted to the allowed zoom modes (true) or not (false). The default value is true. If this flag is true, all the zoom directions are converted to the allowed zoom directions. For example, if only horizontal zoom is allowed, and user zooms in diagonal direction, chart is zoomed horizontally with this flag set to true.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShouldAutoScroll
member.summary: Flag determining if chart should automatically scroll (true) or not (false) to the end if new data are added by the ExtendData call. The default value is false. This flag takes effect in 2D mode only. See also ExtendData. See also ShouldToggleAutoScrollByPan.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.AutoScrollDuration
member.summary: Duration of auto scroll in seconds. The default value is 0.25. See also ExtendData. See also ShouldAutoScroll.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.ShouldToggleAutoScrollByPan
member.summary: Flag determining if automatical scroll should be automatically toggled by pan (true) or not (false). The default value is false. If this flag is true, automatical scroll is switched on (ShouldAutoScroll is set to true) if user pans to the right-most position of the chart and switched off (ShouldAutoScroll is set to false) if user pans left. This flag takes effect in 2D mode only. See also ShouldAutoScroll. See also ExtendData.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.AutoScrollLabel
member.summary: Label that indicates whenever automatical scroll is switched on or off. The default value is null. This label takes effect in 2D mode only. See also ShouldToggleAutoScrollByPan. See also ShouldAutoScroll.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.LicenseKey
member.summary: License key of product.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.VersionInfo
member.summary: Get version info.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChart.Delegate
member.summary: Chart delegate.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartView
member.summary: The NChartView class provides a view to display the chart. This view can be added anywhere to view the hierarchy of the app.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartView.Chart
member.summary: Get chart instance. It is created with the view's creation and destroyed with its destruction.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartView.IsUpdatingEnabled
member.summary: Flag determining if view is allowed to recreate internal rendering data structures (true) or not (false). The deafult value is true. Use this flag to temporary lock the updating of the view. You may need to lock it (by setting false to this poperty) in ViewWillDisappear of your view controller and unlock it (by setting true) in ViewWillAppear. This kind of locking helps to avoid troubles related to the updating of invisible OpenGLES-based views (because in iOS 8+ such updating leads to OpenGLES crash).

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartView.WaitForUpdating
member.summary: Wait for rendering (by pausing calling thread until rendering thread does its job). Use this method whenever you want to guarantee the settings you made in your objects are reflected on the view (for example, by hiding settings screen to guarantee user wont see the last frame of old data). You do not need to call FlushChanges() method of the NChart object if you use this method: the data are synced automatically. See also NChart.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartView.CaptureScreenshot
member.summary: Capture screenshot of the chart to image.
member.returns: new image with the screenshot.

member.summary: Brush that fills the series.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartSolidSeries.BorderBrush
member.summary: Brush of the border that surrounds the series.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartSolidSeriesSettings
member.summary: The NChartSolidSeriesSettings class provides common settings for NChartSolidSeries.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartSolidSeriesSettings.FillRatio
member.summary: Fill ratio for series that determines the amount of place for one series. For example if the fill ratio is 1.0 and the column series is displayed one column (or one group of columns if there are many series on one chart at the same time) fills the whole area of one tick on the X and Z axes (for bar series -- on the Y and Z respectively for area -- it's Z-width and so on). If the fill ratio is 0.5 the column fills half the area of one tick and so on. The default value is 0.7.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings
member.summary: NChartColumnSeriesSettings class provides global settings for NChartColumnSeries.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings.CylindersResolution
member.summary: The resolution of cylinders. Resolution is the amount of vertices that build the circle. For example if you want to get a square column you should set resolution to 4. If you want to get a cylindrical column you may set a larger value. But the larger is the resolution the more memory is used and the slower the rendering will be so you should find out the minimal acceptable value. A good value for cylinder is 16 or 20. The default value is 4. This value cannot be less than 3 and greater than 32.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings.ShouldSmoothCylinders
member.summary: Flag that determines if cylinders should appear smooth (true) of faced (false). Generally if you specify low resolution (see cylindersResolution for details) when the individual faces are still visible it is a good idea to have cylinders faced and vice versa. The default value is false. If cylinders are faced it consumes more memory than if they don't by the same resolution.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings.ShouldGroupColumns
member.summary: Flag that determines if columns should be grouped in the coordinate system cells (true), or not (false). The default value is true. If you have a lot of points that share the same cells, it is good idea to set this flag to true (to let the default), so the columns sharing the cell are distriburted in it. However if you have more than one series which points are not sharing the same cells (for example, each series has only one point that monopolizes the cell), it is better to set this flag to false, so the points are not distributed and each one takes its whole cell.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings.ColumnGroupFillRatio
member.summary: Column group fill ratio for series that determines the amount of place for one column group (for more information about column groups, see ShouldGroupColumns). For example, if this fill ratio is 1.0, columns in the group are sticked together with no gaps between them. If the fill ratio is 0.5, columns in the group have gaps and the total width of the gaps is equal to the total width all columns in the group. The default value is 1.0. The difference from FillRatio is that FillRatio deals with the gap between column groups and ColumnGroupFillRatio is responsible for the gap between columns inside the group.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings.AnimationType
member.summary: Animation type of the transition. The default value is NChartColumnAnimationType.Simultaneously.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartColumnSeriesSettings.CornerRadius
member.summary: Corner radius of the columns relative to the actual column width. The default value is 0. If the radius is 0, columns have sharp corners. If the radius is 1, columns have rounded corners with the radius equal to the half of the columns' width.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartAreaSeries.GradientUniform
member.summary: Flag determining if, in case of gradient brush, the area should have gradient that is interpolated from minimum to maximum values (true), or it should be reinterpolated in each value (false). The default value is false. If this flag is false and the area series has gradient brush, the gradient will probably look like a saw repeating the shape of the area. If this flag is true, the gradient looks linear and do not repeat the shape of the area.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPieSeriesSettings.HoleRatio
member.summary: Hole radius ratio that determines size of the hole for pie series relatively to the whole pie radius. The default value 0.1. This value cannot be less than 0 and greater than 1.0.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPieSeriesSettings.BevelRatio
member.summary: Bevel effect ratio that determines size of the bevel for pie series relatively to the whole pie radius. This property is supported in 2D mode only. The default value is 0.0 (that means no bevel). This value cannot be less than 0.0 and greater than 1.0. You also have to set NChartPieSeries.BevelColor to get the bevel effect.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPieSeriesSettings.CenterCaption
member.summary: Caption that appears in the center of pie.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPieSeries
member.summary: The NChartPieSeries class provides methods to display pie series.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartPieSeries.BevelColor
member.summary: Color of the bevel effect. This property is supported in 2D mode only. The default value is null (that means no bevel). Use this property to add a bevel effect to the series. You can achieve different effects with different colors. For example, to add a shadow inside the pie circle, set the color like UIColor.WithRGBA(0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f, 0.25f). You also have to set NChartPieSeriesSettings.BevelRatio to get the bevel effect.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeries
member.summary: The NChartFunnelSeries class provides methods to display funnel series. This chart type has some specialties: - All axes are ignored, so it is reasonable to hide the axes by displaying funnel chart. - Only the first point from each series, all other points are ignored. - Only Y-value from the point is used, all the other values are ignored.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeries.BottomRadius
member.summary: Bottom radius of the series in interval [0, 1]. The default value is 0.5.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeries.TopRadius
member.summary: Top radius of the series in interval [0,1]. The default value is 0.5.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeriesSettings
member.summary: The NChartFunnelSeriesSettings class provides global settings for NChartFunnelSeries.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeriesSettings.GapSum
member.summary: The sum of gaps between the points in the funnel chart in interval [0, 1]. The deafult value is 0. Actual gap between the points is calculated as gapSum / (countOfPoints - 1) and 1 corresponds to the height of the chart's plot area.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeriesSettings.Resolution
member.summary: The resolution of funnel. Resolution is the amount of vertices that build the circle. For example if you want to get a square funnel, you should set resolution to 4. If you want to get a cylindrical funnel, you may set a larger value. But the larger is the resolution, the more memory is used and the slower the rendering will be, so you should find out the minimal acceptable value. A good value for funnel is 80 or 160. The default value is 120. This value cannot be less than 3 and greater than 360.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartFunnelSeriesSettings.ShouldSmooth
member.summary: Flag that determines if funnel should appear smooth (true) of faced (false). Generally if you specify low resolution when the individual faces are still visible, it is a good idea to have funnel faced and vice versa. The default value is false. If funnel are faced, it consumes more memory than if they don't by the same resolution.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCandlestickSeriesSettings
member.summary: The NChartCandlestickSeriesSettings class provides global settings for NChartCandlestickSeries.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCandlestickSeriesSettings.CylindersResolution
member.summary: The resolution of cylinders. Resolution is the amount of vertices that build the circle. For example if you want to get a square candlestick you should set resolution to 4. If you want to get a cylindrical candlestick you may set a larger value. But the larger is the resolution the more memory is used and the slower the rendering will be so you should find out the minimal acceptable value. A good value for cylinder is 16 or 20. The default value is 20. This value cannot be less than 3 and greater than 32.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartCandlestickSeriesSettings.ShowShadowEndingLines
member.summary: Flag determining whether horizontal lines on the ending of lower and upper candlestick shadows are shown (true) or hidden (false). The default value is true.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartInterpolator
member.summary: The NChartInterpolator class provides base class for different interpolators that can be used to control animations.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartLinearInterpolator
member.summary: The NChartLinearInterpolator class provides linear interpolator. If it is used, the animated values will changed in time as follows: v(t) = (1 - t) * v_from + t * v_to, where v_from, v_to are respectively the start and end values, t is the time.

member.name: T:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBezierInterpolator
member.summary: The NChartBezierInterpolator class provides bezier interpolator. If it is used, the animated values will changed in time as follows: v(t) = (1 - t)^2 * v_from + 2 * t * (1 - t) * v_c + t^2 * v_from, where v_from, v_to are respectively the start and end values, v_c is control point and t is the time.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBezierInterpolator.BezierInterpolatorWithControlPoint(System.Single)
member.summary: Create the bezier iterpolator with given control point.
member.param: - control point. Very oftern it makes sense when the control point is equal to the end value of animated property.
member.returns: new instance of bezier interpolator.

member.name: M:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBezierInterpolator.Constructor(System.Single)
member.summary: Initialize the bezier iterpolator with given control point.
member.param: - control point. Very oftern it makes sense when the control point is equal to the end value of animated property.

member.name: P:NChart3D_iOS.NChartBezierInterpolator.ControlPoint
member.summary: Control point of bezier interpolator.
